business.headline: Sensex surges 900 points: Is Dalal Street's losing streak finally over?Today's relief rally in domestic equities is offering some much-needed respite to traders. But with trade tensions heating up, the volatility isn't going away anytime soon. Is this the beginning of a rebound or just a temporary surge?

M&M shares rise over 4% after UBS upgrade. 3 things investors should know M&M stock price: The brokerage said the recent 19% correction in M&M's share price, compared to Nifty Auto's 13% decline, was an overreaction to EV-related concerns.

Services sector growth accelerates in February backed by strong demandHSBC's final India services Purchasing Managers' Index, compiled by S&P Global, rose to 59.0 in February from January's 26-month low of 56.5 but was lower than a preliminary estimate of 61.1.

What are reciprocal tariffs that Donald Trump mentioned in Congress address?US President Donald Trump announced the implementation of reciprocal tariffs starting next month while addressing a joint session of the US Congress.

Sensex surges 800 points. Why is the stock market rising today?Today's rebound has brought much-needed relief to traders on Dalal Street, reviving hopes of a broader recovery in the days ahead. Here's what's driving the rally and whether the downturn has bottomed out.

Sensex, Nifty bounce back as IT stocks rally; investors remain waryThe Nifty IT index jumped nearly 2%, buoyed by a 10 % surge in Coforge after it signed a 13-year, $1.56 billion deal with Sabre Corp.

Struggling to find your old mutual fund investments? Let Sebi's Mitra help With over 7.5 million inactive folios across different asset management companies (AMCs), Mitra is designed to help investors recover their forgotten investments.
Does marriage impact your credit score? All you need to know While regular payments can improve both scores, any late or default on payments can considerably impact both the scores.

Starting Tuesday, his administration will slap a 25% tariff on goods from Canada and Mexico. The US President is also hiking tariffs on Chinese imports, raising the rate from 10% to 20%.

The notice, dated 27 February, was related to alleged violations of FEMA rules between 2015 and 2019.

Why has Radhika Gupta compared Nifty to Shah Rukh Khan? Details hereNifty has hit its longest losing streak in 29 years, wiping out Rs 90 lakh crore in investor wealth since hitting its peak in September. The Sensex has fallen over 12% since its September 2024 all-time high, when it touched its peak at 85,478.25.

entertainment.headline: Black Doves: Keira Knightley show is essential viewing for thriller enthusiastsBritish stars Keira Knightley and Ben Whishaw's thriller series Black Doves is both relentless and rewarding. The underrated gem is currently streaming on Netflix.

Honey Singh set to perform in Delhi, excited fans rush to the venueSinger and rapper Honey Singh is set to perform in Delhi today as part of his ongoing Millionaire India tour. Ahead of the concert, excited fans were seen rushing to the venue as soon as the gates opened.

Honey Singh returns to Delhi for sold-out Millionaire concert: What to expectYo Yo Honey Singh's Millionaire India Tour hits Delhi with a sold-out show, 20,000 fans, top celebs, and a surprise setlist. His parents will attend the concert, making this emotional homecoming extra special.

Honey Singh wishes to team up with Diljit Dosanjh, urges fans to make it happenSinger Honey Singh, currently touring India for his Millionaire India Tour, expressed his desire to collaborate with Diljit Dosanjh again during his recent concert in Lucknow. Alter Ego review: Blackpink's Lisa's album is versatile and powerfulLisa of Blackpink releases her solo album Alter Ego. With a total of 15 songs and several collaborations, the album has a lot to take away from, but Lisa shines the brightest in her solo elements.

The show has interesting ideas, but it gets lost in the overstretched screenplay.

Meghan Markle discusses food, music and Korea in new glimpse of 'With Love, Meghan'Meghan Markle and chef Roy Choi bond over food and the culture of South Korea as they discuss Karoake bars and music in the new promo for her Netflix show, 'With Love, Meghan'.

general news.headline: Top Karnataka cop's actor-daughter arrested in Bengaluru for smuggling goldKannada actress Ranya Rao was arrested at Bengaluru airport for allegedly smuggling 14.8 kg of gold worth Rs 12 crore from Dubai. More gold found at actor Ranya Rao's Bengaluru home after stunning airport haulThe Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) raided Kannada actor Ranya Rao's residence after intercepting her at Bengaluru airport with 14.2 kg of smuggled gold. The search led to the seizure of gold jewelry worth Rs 2.06 crore and Rs 2.67 crore in cash.

Where's the drama? India's Champions Trophy run is like a spoilerThe Champions Trophy feels like a whodunnit in reverse -- its ending obvious from the start, with India crushing Australia in a lopsided semi-final. Every time Australia dared to dream, India punched them in the face, and didn't let the game stray from its inevitable ending.

Watch: Virat Kohli fist pumps in joy as Anushka Sharma cheers for himChampions Trophy 2025: Virat Kohli celebrated wholeheartedly as his wife Anushka Sharma cheered for him from the stands after India beat Australia in the semi-final.

You judge Rohit Sharma by stats, we judge by impact: Gautam GambhirChampions Trophy 2025: Head coach Gautam Gambhir was unimpressed when he was asked about Rohit Sharma's future, moments after India beat Australia in the semi-final in Dubai on Tuesday.

India didn't have any 'undue advantage' in Dubai: Gautam Gambhir Champions Trophy 2025: Head coach Gautam Gambhir said that India haven't got any undue advantage in Dubai since it's a neutral venue for them. On Tuesday, India advanced to the final after beating Australia by four wickets.

Not buying into it: Steve Smith on India's Dubai advantage theoryChampions Trophy 2025: Skipper Steve Smith accepted defeat gracefully, saying that India outplayed Australia in the semi-final on Tuesday at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium.

Watch: Virat Kohli fist pumps in joy as Anushka Sharma cheers for himChampions Trophy 2025: Virat Kohli celebrated wholeheartedly as his wife Anushka Sharma cheered for him from the stands after India beat Australia in the semi-final.

You judge Rohit Sharma by stats, we judge by impact: Gautam GambhirChampions Trophy 2025: Head coach Gautam Gambhir was unimpressed when he was asked about Rohit Sharma's future, moments after India beat Australia in the semi-final in Dubai on Tuesday.

Where's the drama? India's Champions Trophy run is like a spoilerThe Champions Trophy feels like a whodunnit in reverse -- its ending obvious from the start, with India crushing Australia in a lopsided semi-final. Every time Australia dared to dream, India punched them in the face, and didn't let the game stray from its inevitable ending.

What more can I do? KL Rahul hits back at trolls after knock vs AustraliaIndia batter KL Rahul hit back at trolls for constantly questioning his position in the ODI team. KL Rahul's comments came after the batter took India over the line in the semi-final against Australia.

Watch: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma bromance stands out in emotional celebrationIndia vs Australia, Champions Trophy 2025: The Indian dressing room was on an emotional high after KL Rahul hit the winning runs in their 265-run chase in Dubai on Tuesday. Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma were seen sharing a warm hug before Kohli soaked in the applause from the crowd.

Some are perpetual cribbers: Gambhir slams critics in fiery presserIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir hit out at critics after India reached the final of the Champions Trophy on Tuesday, March 4. Gambhir slammed the people who have taken a veiled dig at India for playing the tournament at the same venue.

Gautam Gambhir lashes out at criticism of Virat Kohli against leg spinIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir lashed out at criticism of Virat Kohli against leg spin following his match-winning knock against Australia in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025.

Don't talk revenge, just enjoy the sport: Gavaskar on India beating AustraliaChampions Trophy 2025: Speaking to India Today, legendary Sunil Gavaskar said India were the better team against a hamstrung Australian side in the semi-final on Sunday. The former captain lauded Virat Kohli's responsible 84, calling him one of the greatest chasers in ODI history.

Winning tosses or matches? Rohit Sharma has a favouriteRohit Sharma's luck at the toss continues to falter as he lost his 11th consecutive toss in India's Champions Trophy semi-final against Australia. With an unwanted record looming, does it really impact India's chances?

Virat Kohli the greatest among greats in ODI run chases: Kapil Dev Champions Trophy 2025: Speaking to India Today, legendary Kapil Dev said Virat Kohli is a cut above the rest when it comes to ODI run-chases. Kohli hit a well-paced 84 as India knocked Australia out of the tournament in Dubai on Tuesday.

Virat Kohli on missing semis hundred: Wins matter, not milestonesChampions Trophy 2025: Virat Kohli missed out on a well-deserved hundred by 16 runs, but the former captain played a key role in helping India outclass Australia in Dubai. Kohli said he is no longer particular about milestones and landmarks.

Chase master Virat Kohli fires India into final, sends Australia home Champions Trophy 2025, India vs Australia semifinal: Virat Kohli came up with a solid batting display as India registered a record chase to beat Australia. The Men in Blue qualified for the final of the Champions Trophy for the third successive time.

Kohli emulates Sachin Tendulkar after 8,000 runs in ODI chasesVirat Kohli joins Sachin Tendulkar as only the second batter to cross 8000 runs in ODI run-chases, reinforcing his reputation as India's ultimate chase master after anchoring the Champions Trophy semi-final win over Australia.

SA vs NZ, all you need to know: Lahore pitch report, live streamingSouth Africa and New Zealand are all set to lock horns in the second semi-final of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Both teams will carry their rich form into the all-important clash.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
